The training rule on receiving a mixed almsfood

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū piṇḍapātaṁ paṭiggaṇhantā sūpaññeva bahuṁ paṭiggaṇhanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhantā bahum paṭiggaṇhanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six received almsfood that was mostly broth.

analyzed: sama sūpakam piṇḍapātam paṭiggahessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will receive almsfood that is mixed with broth,’ this is how you should train.”

analyzed: dve sūpā mugga sūpaḥ māsa sūpaḥ hattha hāriyaḥ
translated: there are two kinds of broth: mung-bean broth and black-gram broth.
You should receive almsfood that is mixed with broth.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca sūpaññeva bahuṁ paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca su upaññā iva bahum paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood that is mostly broth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if it is unintentional,🔽if he does not know,
if he is not being disrespectful,🔽if he is sick,🔽if it is just a little broth,
if it is his relatives,🔽if it is his regular supporters,
if it is for the benefit of someone else,
if it is with his own money,
in the case of an emergency,🔽if he is insane,
if he is the first offender.🔽The ninth training rule is finished.
